intro: Philadelphus oblongifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaved mock orange, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern North America. It is characterized by its opposite, ovate to elliptic leaves that are typically 2–6 inches long. The plant produces fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers in clusters during late spring to early summer. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardens. Its showy blooms attract pollinators like bees and butterflies, contributing to local biodiversity.
